column4: ouellettesr-> can you acquire an ip address? what is your network layout?
i cant ping the router, I have an old compaq 5190 with onboard lan, and I have a pci nic as well neither of them work, i have notices something i have never seen before and that is an etho:avah
yes cables are known to be good, and i can ping localhost
still nothing means still no internet.. I assigned an ip of 192.1.68.1.107, 255.255.255.0, 192.1.68.1.1
assigning an ip has always worked to get internet before
nope i changed the subnet, it is 192.168.0.107
i changed my routers ip to 192.168.0.110
yeah the cable works, i pulled it from a working computer, it must be the nics
yeah there is a pci, and onboard, i have tried both of them
it says no MII interfaces found
cwillu, eth0 100 Mbit, half duplex, no link
cwillu, if i unplug the cable from the pci and run that command again it says no-link
i have both, and have been trying both with everything
yes, there is only one ip to set and that is eth0, there is no eth1
if i type ifconfig, there is only eth0 and eth0:avah
its the pci, when i have it pluggen into pci, i type, mii-tool, and it says:  eth0 100 Mbit, half duplex, no link..... But if i unplug the pci and type mii-tool it says: no link
